text: This is a list of college women's basketball coaches by number of career wins. The list includes only games at the NCAA, AIAW and NAIA levels. Pat Summitt, who was the head coach of the Tennessee Lady Volunteers from 1974-2012, tops the list with 1,098 career wins. The highest winning percentage in the group belongs to Geno Auriemma, head coach of the UConn Huskies since 1985, with an career winning percentage. The fastest coach to reach 600 wins is Brian Morehouse, current head coach of the Division III Hope Flying Dutch, who reached the mark in his 690th game on January 25, 2020. ==NCAA and NAIA women's basketball coaches with 600 wins== ===Key=== {| class="wikitable" |- | bgcolor="#ffe5b4" | | bgcolor="#ffe5b4" |Expected to be active in the 2020–21 season |- | * | Elected to the Women's Basketball Hall of Fame |- | ** | Elected to both the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame and the Women's Basketball Hall of Fame |} The source for all statistics and schedules for NCAA teams is https://stats.ncaa.org/head_coaches'' Sources for NAIA teams are specified in the relevant entries. ===Coaches=== Final statistics after 2019-20 season {| class="wikitable sortable" valign="bottom" |- ! style="width: 5%;" | Rank ! style="width: 20%; class=" unsortable " | Name ! style="width: 5%;" | Years ! style="width: 5%;" | Wins ! style="width: 5%;" | Losses ! style="width: 5%;" | Pct. ! style="width: 50%;" class="unsortable" | Teams (Seasons) |- |1 |Pat Summitt ** |38 |1,098 |208 | |Tennessee (1974–2012) |- |2 |style="background-color:#FFE5B4" | Tara VanDerveer ** |41 |1,094 |253 | |Idaho (1978–80), Ohio State (1980–85), Stanford (1985–95, 1996–) |- |3 |style="background-color:#FFE5B4" | Geno Auriemma ** |35 |1,091 |142 | |UConn (1985–) |- |4 |Barbara Stevens ** |43 |1,058 |291 | |Clark (MA) (1977–83), Massachusetts (1983–86), Bentley (1986–2020) |- |5 |style="background- color:#FFE5B4" | C.
